alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 12 at 2:38AM EDT until April 12 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Broward, Coastal Miami-Dade, Metro Broward and Metro Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain is expected today ahead of an approaching warm front. 2 to 5 inches of rain is forecast with localized amounts greater than 6 inches possible. This amount of rain on already saturated soils from recent rainfall may result in flooding conditions, especially for poor drainage locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Coastal Miami Dade County
